Description: Small silver pendant or amulet in the form of a seated Egyptianizing figure wearing a pointed headdress, possibly Harpokrates with the combined pharaonic crowns of Upper and Lower Egypt; described as nude in the register but the corroded state of the metal makes this difficult to determine; the arms, part of the legs, and part of the suspension-ring at the back are broken away.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2052)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 504, p. 78)
